CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Henry, 2319 Gironde Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: �Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?� answer reads: "Yes, I think so, because it helps the colored race. I, like others, like to see our race get ahead."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Henry, wearing light colored hat, eyeglasses, earrings, necklace, bracelet, and polka dot dress with bow at collar, holding light colored handbag and plaid umbrella, standing on Penn Avenue next to garbage can inscribed "Help Keep Your City Clean", across the street from the Stanley Theatre, Downtown
